summary: This is an internal email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the compilation of forfeiture funding requests for Fiscal Year 2020. It includes a reminder and instructions for unit chiefs to submit requests for case-related expenses, with attached forms for specific cases, including one related to Epstein.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as a recipient, along with the email sender, for the completed FY20 funding request forms from unit chiefs and AUSAs.

events.title: Criminal Unit Chiefs Meeting
events.description: A meeting where the process for obtaining forfeiture funding for case expenses from EOUSA was discussed.

events.title: Deadline for FY20 Forfeiture Funding Requests
events.description: Internal deadline for unit chiefs to submit their funding request forms for the upcoming fiscal year.

events.title: EOUSA Submission Deadline
events.description: The date by which the Office's compiled forfeiture funding requests for FY20 are due to the Executive Office for United States Attorneys (EOUSA).

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document is an internal email about securing forfeiture funds for FY20 (September 2020 to September 2021) for case expenses.
It reveals the funding process covers expenses like financial analysis, document review, forensic analysis, expert consultants, data hosting, translation, and foreign travel.
Attached to the email were specific funding request forms for large cases, including one explicitly named 'Epstein_FY20_Request_Form-_Large_Case_Related_Expenses.docx'.
The communication indicates the Epstein case was active and significant enough to warrant a specific, pre-prepared funding request form as of April 2019.
